Posts.Content: Thanks guys, Im dreading the next two treatments as i dont cope with pain very well, I still have some cocodomol that they sent me home from hospital with so I can take them if needed. Thanks xxx
Posts.Title: Docetaxel and Pregabalin?

Posts.Content: Hi I had my first Docetaxal last week after 3 fec and ended up in serve pain, I phone the unit, went in and was neutropic. I ended up spending 4 days in hospital and have now been put on Pregabalin to help with the pain next time around. Has anyone else had this and did it help? Im really worried about the next lot not sure i can cope with that sort of pain again, felt like i had been hit by a bus! Thanks guys xxx
Posts.Title: Docetaxel and Pregabalin?

Posts.Content: Glad I read this though it was just me xxx
Posts.Title: Weird dreams

Posts.Content: I had  to laugh when my teenage daughter burst into my room and asked me if I had taken her straightners then my 9 year old asked me if I had her hairbrush, I dont have any hair I lol dont know what they though I would be doing with them. we have to keep laughing,I cant be sad when i've got my hubby and girls to make me laugh x
Posts.Title: A post chemo smile!

Posts.Content: I was admitted too after first tax and had my dose reduced by 20% I was given pregabalin to help with the pain (i take 3 per day everyday) and these have helped. I ached for about 10 dasy after chemo a couple of days after I stopped the injections (sorry cant remember what they are called) Hope your next treatment is better for you xxx
Posts.Title: Had a melt down! Thanks for listening to my sound off!

Posts.Content: I'm her2+  and I haven't been told to avoid anything. I still eat everything  it's hard enough going through chemo without worrying about if something you eat is going to bring back you cancer. I am going to continue to eat the things I like because I would like to enjoy my life. I think if foods cause cancer we would be told to avoid them by the doctors and nurses. Hope this helps xxx
Posts.Title: cancer and diet

Posts.Content: Thank you I am normally really positive, as one of my friends said when I first told them; You are so competitive that there is no way you will come second to cancer' and that what im like, so nice to know I not the ony one and that im nearly there with chemo and that rads wont be to bad, just the heceptin to do (thats for a year) and your right Cassie we have had the best treatment around so for that i am grateful nig hugs to you xxx
Posts.Title: Tears - feeling low

Posts.Content: Thanks Kelzy It does help, my family have been wonderful but sometime you just need to let it out. I have had my op first only found traces in 1 lymph node, her2+ so having chemo, rads and heceptin. I turned 40 in the summer. Glad you have finished chemo 1 more for me at the end of the month good luck with you op. Your little one is so young, how did you cope I have found chemo really hard and my girls are that bit older, they really have had to grow up this summer I feel for them having this hanging over them, My 9 year old asked me if I was going to be ok once chemo and rads finished, fingers crossed I will be, just having a wobble today im normally very positive. Hugs back xxx
Posts.Title: Tears - feeling low

Posts.Content: OMG just sobbed watching children in need from last night, The story about the lady with breast cancer that came back and she was dying. such a sad story and such brave kids. Now its all I keep thinking about I too have young children 13 and 9. I'm putting on such a brave face at the moment in front of everyone, Im 5 treatment into 6 of chemo then radio after, If I see people out they keep telling me how well I look...I just want to scream 'do you know how bad it is? how ill i feel?' but no I just keep smiling arrgh...sorry just needed a rant .....Its the unknown thats doing my head in am I going to be one of the lucky ones or is it going to come back????
Posts.Title: Tears - feeling low

Posts.Content: I know how you feel I was also diagnosed in May had fec-t and starting rads on wednesday also  herceptin no tamoxifen. I have felt really stressed the last few day really snappy with the oh and kids. Think its the end of chemo thought i would feel better but i still feel rubbish, We have to remember what a roller coster  we have been on the last 8 months, sending you a hug xxx
Posts.Title: Really fed up

Posts.Content: Congrats on finishing chemo and going back to work, Im a TA too and am really missing being at work, I have missed all the new reception children starting and feel like a fraud when im having a good week that im not at work but my dr has told me to stay off while having chemo. I wondered about the flu jab do you have to wait until you have finish chemo to have it?  Have fun and enjoy being back xxx
Posts.Title: Might be going back to work :)

Posts.Content: Congrats on finishing chemo and going back to work, Im a TA too and am really missing being at work, I have missed all the new reception children starting and feel like a fraud when im having a good week that im not at work but my dr has told me to stay off while having chemo. I wondered about the flu jab do you have to wait until you have finish chemo to have it?  Have fun and enjoy being back xxx
Posts.Title: Might be going back to work :)

Posts.Content: Hi im a HER2+ and have got to have FEC-T plus Heceptin with the T. I have read lots of threads on here about FEC and the dreaded T. I have had 2 fec so far. I really don't want to know what to expect? I am hoping to go back to work after chemo and rads (after my chemo I think haven't been given a date) but i'm not sure what the s/e are with Heceptin or if work will continue to give me odd days off for treatment, I have already been off 6 weeks after WLE went back for 2 then started chemo and have been off since (I work as a TA so cant go back in case of infection) Thanks xxx
Posts.Title: FEC-T and Heceptin ??? What to expect?

Posts.Content: I'm starting to plan mine for the end of my treatment next October (got to have Hecepten for a year after chemo and rads ) so Go for it i'm going too xxx
Posts.Title: Tempting fate....ridiculous

Posts.Content: Please dont leave I love reading your posts make me realise that we are all human we have good days we have bad days, having this forum really helps,I can talk about what I what without worrying that I will upset any of my family. We are all travelling through this journey whether we like it or not and we all need all the support we can get. I have had bad day sand people telling me how 'brave' I am (god that mads me so mad) but you will get through this and you will look back and think that made me stronger xxx
Posts.Title: Wishing everyone well and goodbye

Posts.Content: Thank you just having a wobble, worried that after all this it wont work and it will come back. Your comments have really helped, just need to stop worrying so much, easier said then done I know. Thanks for the hugs sending some back to you xxx
Posts.Title: Reduction in Docetaxal/Tax has anyone else had this? Will it still...

Posts.Content: I went for my 2nd lot of tax today and was told it had been reduced by 20% as I had such a bad reaction to it last time, really bad pain and infection. Ended up i hospital for 4 day and am now on pregabalin for long term pain control.Has anyone else had this? Im worried that is not going to work if they dont give my all the dose? or am I being silly? Thank you xxxx
Posts.Title: Reduction in Docetaxal/Tax has anyone else had this? Will it still...

Posts.Content: Hi I had 4 nodes removed (including the sentinel node) cancer was found in 1 (micro metastases) but my doctor is not going to remove all of them as he feels that they will be clear and I could be worse off with lymphoedema . I am her2+ so am having chemo, rads and heceptin so that should blast anything left swimming about. I am happy to follow his advise after all they are the experts. Hope all works out for you xxx
Posts.Title: Remove or Not Remove Underarm Lymph Nodes

Posts.Content: Hi I used black or dark purple nail varnish thought out my chemo FEC-T now 6 weeks post chemo and still have all my finger and toe nails a bit flaky but growing well x Hope it works for you xxx
Posts.Title: Black nail varnish & Docetaxel

Posts.Content: Hi I was told the if I think that I might have any sort of infection that I need to phone the chemo nurses first. I have phoned a couple of time with queries and they are lovely (I came up in a red rash after chemo and wanted to check) I would give them a call. If you do go to hospital or your local walk in center dont wait around show your card and tell them your having chemo. good luck hope you get it sorted xxx
Posts.Title: Embarassing, but I need relief!
